data.title: Added a lint test for actor locations
data.body: I wanted to write a lint check to detect flaws like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8115 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8467 and was surprised how often actors share a location in the maps we ship. Not sure how to deal with that.

```
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: La référence d'objet n'est pas définie à une instance d'un objet.

   à Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient._HandleEvents(IrcMessageData ircdata)
```

data.title: Prevent projectiles from overshooting blocking actors
data.body:
One of the prerequisites for directional armor and explosion effects.

While the issue with blockable projectiles passing through walls was fixed a while ago, they still quite often explode on the 'wrong side' of the blocking actor.

This PR calculates the direction the projectile came from and enforces the explosion to happen on the side facing the source (or at least previous position of the projectile).

The concrete walls in our shipping mods already provide a good test case for this.

data.body:
follow-up from #11230 ( @Mailaender : please stop closing (my) tickets without giving a prove-link for the fix ... thx)

data.title: Fix trait lookup of destroyed actor in SpawnActorOnDeath
data.body:
The sequence of events leading to that crash looks like this:
1. Truk enters a building.
2. `Enter.FindAndTransitionToNextState()` is running, and since `DonateSupplies` uses `EnterBehaviour.Dispose`, `Actor.Dispose()` runs for the actor, queueing a FrameEndTask.
3. Truk is then killed:
   - `Health.InflictDamage()` first calls `SpawnActorOnDeath.Killed()`, which queues a FrameEndTask during which some trait lookups happen.
   - `Health.InflictDamage()` then calls `Actor.Dispose()` as well, queueing another FrameEndTask (which will never run, the game crashes before).
4. After the tick, the first FrameEndTask disposes of the actor. The second FrameEndTask would spawn the crate from the truk, but the trait lookups then fail and throw an exception.

data.title: Add TheRaffy to AUTHORS
data.body: To credit him for the `WeatherOverlay` which is featured in releases for quite some time now.

data.title: Fix possible instant repairs by spamming Repair activities
data.body: Noticeable when spam-clicking on a naval yard/sub pen.

data.title: Fix the prerequisite of the supply truck being displayed
data.body:
We don't do this for other units that only require a war factory (like the light tank or ranger) either.
Reported by `theKalash` [on Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/openra/comments/4hgzd3/a_couple_of_minor_bugs/d2qx505).

data.title: Minelayer sound-issues
data.body:
release-20151224 - RedAlert
- you can hear "every" minelayer" including your enemys minelayer , when they stand on a repair-pad and reload 
- once the minelayer has finished "reloading" , a voice-message saying "Unit Repaired" pops up which isnt appropriate for having finished "reloading" ...

data.title: [RA] France - add fake Service Depot
data.body: The supposed strength of France is deception so where is the fake Service Depot? Deciding between Service Depot and the Radar dome is the first choice in picking the tech route for Allied players.

data.title: Update appdata description using text from the website About page.
data.body:
![screen shot 2016-05-05 at 21 53 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/15056964/5e831c28-130c-11e6-838d-8051f059c634.png)

This updates the appdata description that will be shown in the gnome software center with the newer and improved text from http://www.openra.net/about/.

data.title: Fixes Utility import facings mirror-flip
data.body:
Solves #8544.
Tested on several maps and it seems to work.
I warn you that I know next to nothing about C# or how it uses integers like that, but the scope of that should still be 0-255.
If you think there is some issue/harm being done with crude hack like this, we can rework it.

data.title: Fix the supply truck in allies03b not being targetable by tanya
data.body: You need to be able to target it with her colt as the truck is moving away (thus you won't be able to C4 it).

data.title: Re-instate owner row for oil pumps and tech buildings in TD
data.body: Fixes #11219.

data.title: Harvester self-healing to 50%
data.body:
After a quick discussion in IRC where there were mostly possitive responses to this idea, I create this ticket to track the disscusion about the possibility to implement original harvester self-healing.

There are several factors to consider, especially balance in early rushing tactics and the speed of heal, which was quite slow in original. Please, feel free to elaborate your opinon on this idea.

data.title: Cleaned up logically dead Missile code.
data.body: `targetPassedBy` is always true in this section and `-` times `-` is `+`. Dirty copy pasta code detected by Coverity.

data.title: Allow Chinook to land/deploy on gems
data.body: As reported in #10291.

data.title: Map update: Symmetrification of some popular maps
data.body:
- Rogue States, Manufacturing Consent and Necessary Illusions are now near-perfectly symmetrical. Hopefully this will make them more appealing for tournament play. Their overall form hasn't changed much, but they had some lines redrawn and a general cleanup. Necessary Illusions is now a temperate tileset because people complained the snow tileset hurts their eyes.
- Letters from Lexington was re-added after symmetrification and some minor layout adjustments for playability and fairness, including removal of viceroids due to their new "roaming" behaviour.

Link to maps at Resource center:
Necessary Illusions http://resource.openra.net/maps/11716/
Manufacturing Consent http://resource.openra.net/maps/11715/
Rogue States http://resource.openra.net/maps/11098/
Letters from Lexington http://resource.openra.net/maps/11721/

Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie) 32-Bit , Gnome 3.14.1
Wine-1.9.9

both on release and playtest , when i try to start OpenRA after installing, it spits out : 

`Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 5.1.2600.196608 Service Pack 3)
Runtime Version: Mono 4.3.3 (tarball) CLR 4.6.57.0
Exception of type `System.TypeInitializationException`: The type initializer for 'OpenRA.ModMetadata' threw an exception.
Inner Exception of type `System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException`: Directory 'C:\Program Files\OpenRA-releasemods' not found.
    at System.IO.Directory.ValidateDirectoryListing (System.String path, System.String searchPattern, System.Boolean& stop) <0x1e08678 + 0x0019b> in <filename unknown>:0

  at System.IO.Directory.GetDirectories (System.String path, System.String searchPattern) <0x1e08480 + 0x00027> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.Directory.GetDirectories (System.String path) <0x1e08450 + 0x0001b> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.ModMetadata.ValidateMods () <0x1dfc6d0 + 0x00107> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.ModMetadata..cctor () <0x1dfc6a0 + 0x0000b> in <filename unknown>:0

  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x1dd0f70 + 0x000cb> in <filename unknown>:0`

data.title: Player owned Oil Derricks nameless. (TD)
data.body:
A player owning an oil derrick in TD does not show who owns the oil derrick. It simply just has the name "Oil Derrick" on it. Yet the color shows the owner of the structure.

(Unsure if this is a bug or intentional.)

data.title: Supply trucks destroyed right before entering a building causes the game to crash
data.body:
Was messing around in debug mode and got a crash when the AI destroyed a supply truck which was just about to enter a building.

Here's the exception.log:

> Red Alert Mod at Version release-20151224
> on map 44c32eea46646e757b38779d772407908e32e6f6 (Crater Lake by Raymundo).
> Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
> Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
> Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (truk 309 (not in world))
>    at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor)
>    at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.GetOrDefault[T](Actor actor)
>    at OpenRA.Actor.TraitOrDefault[T]()
>    at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Traits.SpawnActorOnDeath.<Killed>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0(World w)
>    at OpenRA.World.Tick()
>    at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
>    at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
>    at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
>    at OpenRA.Game.Run()
>    at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
>    at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Fix self-healing percentage in yaml rules for all mods
data.body: From https://redd.it/4hgzd3

data.title: Make the circle and arrow sequences of Beacon optional
data.body: You might only want to use one of them, especially for support powers, where you can't use `AnimatedBeacon` or just want a `beaconposter` without any other animations.

data.title: Extract common campaign rules for d2k and ra
Neutral structure garrisoning
data.body:
I am not sure if similar request was poster before but bear with me.
Perhaps though introducing a ChangeOwner trait, with upgrade system.
This would allow for an actor to temporary change its ownership to the owner of the passenger for example, which would make garrison-able buildings possible along with a lot of other possibilities.

data.title: Combined sequences don't inherit defaults
data.body:
``` yaml
northwestsoutheastbridge:
    idle:
        Combine:
            lobrdg01:
                UseTilesetExtension: true
```

works, but

``` yaml
northwestsoutheastbridge:
    Defaults:
        UseTilesetExtension: true
    idle:
        Combine:
            lobrdg01:
```

won't.

data.title: Turning looks too smooth
data.body: I've read criticism about how OpenRA's turning mechanism doesn't look good visually, and I'm inclined to agree. It's particularly noticable on half-circles around 1-cell obstacles and such, it somehow looks unnatural and too smooth.

data.title: Added a CustomTerrainDebugOverlay
data.body: A custom terrain visualizing debug overlay, see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10764#issuecomment-186585903
